data.title: Washington Space Business Roundtable on LinkedIn: Home
data.meta_description:
WSBR is proud to announce the launch of our brand new and improved website! https://wsbr.org/ 

Please take a look to find out more about upcoming events‚Ä¶
data.text:
üåü "Networking allows your net to get what it needs to work." üåü Last night was great! I attended a Cardiff Young Professionals networking event. It was an evening filled with like-minded individuals who are passionate about their ambitions and dreams. Countless meaningful conversations flowed seamlessly throughout the event. Great to connect with you all ü§ù The highlight of the night was the speech delivered by Rob Dance. It was inspirational but he also provided practical insights and examples to help us achieve outstanding results. He went beyond just speaking; he offered a platform for questions and committed to ongoing support for professionals like us. That was the üçí on top! Rob and I had an interesting conversation. We shared some insights. My üîë takeaway is: "You work, you learn, you succeed, and in return, you share your knowledge to help others create their own path using the blueprint you provide. Knowledge is at its best when it's shared." Let's continue to network, connect, and uplift each other. üí™ü§ù #Networking #ProfessionalDevelopment #KnowledgeSharing #CardiffYouth

The events industry is a key part of the social and economic fabric of Scotland. 'Scotland: the perfect stage' was first published in 2008 as a strategy for supporting and further developing the events sector in Scotland. This has undergone an extensive review and renewal process to focus on where the sector will be by 2035. It has included a consultation process which took place this summer. We provided the analysis of this consultation which identified key themes and areas of focus. This work will input into policy development to help support this vibrant and exciting sector for the next 10 years. üìã To read about our findings: https://lnkd.in/excD43kE üé≠ To find out more about our work in this area: https://lnkd.in/ergJ6rPu üìë To read the full report: https://lnkd.in/e3A4j5cZ üëâ To find out more: Andy Parkinson VisitScotland #ConsultationAnalysis #WavehillResearch #Scotland #Events

As we all know, minority-owned businesses play a vital role in our local economy. They bring innovation, diversity, and unique perspectives that enrich our entrepreneurial community. However, these businesses often face unique challenges on their path to success. This is where SCMBA (and the Minority Business Assistance Center) comes in: SCMBA's mission is to foster the development and growth of minority-owned businesses in Stark County, creating opportunities for economic empowerment. Here's how you can be part of this journey: Follow Our Page: By simply hitting the "Follow" button on our page, you stay updated with our latest initiatives, success stories, and events. Your support encourages others to join our cause. Engage and Share: Following us is just the beginning. Engage with our posts by commenting, sharing, and spreading the word about the work we're doing. Your engagement amplifies our message and reaches a broader audience. Volunteer or Collaborate: If you have skills, expertise, or resources to contribute, we welcome your involvement. Attend Our Events: Keep an eye out for our upcoming events, workshops, and networking opportunities. Let's make a difference, one like and follow at a time!

Dread Going Solo to Conferences and Events? Mimi Bishop and I have you covered! Say Hello to our Networking Buddy Program at The ReImagine Conference. We believe in the strength of community and the power of inclusion. That's why we're excited to introduce our Networking Buddy Program! We want every attendee to feel warm, welcomed, and confident. With a wing-woman by your side, you'll never have to navigate the event alone. Embrace the confidence that comes in numbers and make connections that matter. How does it work? 1. Register for The ReImagine Conference 2. Check YES, I'd like to be paired with a Networking Buddy. 3. In May, you'll be connected to your Networking Buddy 4. Connect beforehand and plan on your meeting spot 5. Confidently experience the conference feeling connected Join us for an experience where every introduction is a step towards connection, community, and getting business done. https://lnkd.in/etpVEG_5
